benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Trigger a payment for all unpaid invoices

covered: Valid Payload: TC01 and TC02 demonstrate successful POST with required fields and optional parameters (HTTP 204).

Invalid Payload: TC11-TC16 cover invalid inputs and header validation (e.g., invalid paymentMethodId, negative/zero paymentAmount, malformed targetDate, non-boolean externalPayment, invalid pluginProperty, missing/empty X-Killbill-CreatedBy).
Authorization & Authentication: TC10 and TC17 validate missing header and unauthorized access scenarios.
Existence & State Validation: TC08/TC09 cover invalid/non-existent accountId; TC06/TC07 cover accounts with no unpaid invoices or no invoices remaining.
Edge Cases & Input Validation: TC25 (extra unknown query parameters), TC26 (state variation), TC23/TC24 (extremely large paymentAmount and pluginProperty arrays).
Error Coverage: TC18/TC19 system errors (gateway/database), TC27 integration failure, TC22 recovery from transient network errors.
Security: TC20 (SQL injection) and TC21 (XSS) tests.
Backward Compatibility & Regression: TC29 compatibility with older clients; TC28 duplicate payments on retry.
Performance & Accessibility: TC30-TC32 performance tests; TC33 API documentation accessibility.
Observability & Data Integrity: Tests ensure proper error content for invalid inputs (TC08, TC11-16) and 204 responses for successful operations.
gaps: Rate limiting and throttling tests are not present.
Observability metrics/logs validation are not covered.
Scalability tests with a very large number of unpaid invoices are not explicitly tested.
Additional concurrency stress tests beyond single-retry scenarios could be added.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests (e.g., burst requests) to validate throttling behavior.
Introduce observability tests verifying metrics/logs for this endpoint (request counts, error rates).
Add stress tests with a very large dataset of unpaid invoices to evaluate performance at scale.
Extend concurrency tests to validate idempotency under parallel retries and race conditions.
Expand security coverage with more token/header edge cases and input sanitization checks.
